title: Bad Bunny Wins Big Award and Stars Talk About Immigrants
summary: Bad Bunny made history by winning the Grammy Award for Album of the Year, becoming the first Latin artist to do so in 68 years. At the ceremony, many famous singers spoke up to support immigrants. Bad Bunny dedicated his award to immigrants who leave their homes to chase their dreams. Other stars like Olivia Dean and Billie Eilish also talked about how immigrants are brave and important. Some musicians wore badges that said 'ICE out' to show they disagree with immigration rules. The event was full of music and messages about kindness and fairness for all people.
